title: Penn transitions to remote learning
description: The coronavirus outbreak in March plunged academics and student life at Penn into uncertainty, indefinitely.
author: Komal Patel

title: Penn and Philadelphia show up for Black Lives Matter
description: After the police killing of George Floyd sparked a nationwide Black Lives Matter movement in May, protests for racial justice flooded the streets of Philadelphia.
author: Jonah Charlton

title: The fight for Penn to pay PILOTs intensifies
description: Student and faculty demands for Penn to pay PILOTs were reignited this summer amid the Black Lives Matter movement.
author: Shirali Shah

title: Penn takes center stage in the 2020 presidential election
description: The history-making presidential election saw an intense battle between former Penn professor Joe Biden and 1968 Wharton graduate and Republican incumbent Donald Trump, with Pennsylvania flipping blue to propel Biden to the White House.
author: Celia Kreth and Tori Sousa

title: Penn shakes up University leadership
description: Wharton made history by appointing the school's first Black and female dean, and the University Chaplain is taking on additional responsibilities as Vice President for Social Equity and Community.
author: Anya Tullman

title: Students struggle to adapt to virtual classes
description: Students said some labs were difficult to follow given the absence of immediate help and feedback from a teaching assistant who would typically oversee the labs in person.
author: Lindsey Perlman

title: COVID-19, civil unrest cause Philadelphia businesses to suffer
description: Many students feel that they should not have to incur expensive shipping fees or risk contracting coronavirus on the trek to the Penn Tennis Center or their moving company's warehouse to retrieve their belongings.
author: Elizabeth Meisenzahl
